executiveSummary: Arthur Greer and Michael Wooley presented Vestpakz, a backpack-vest hybrid invented by Greer’s daughter, seeking $50,000 for 10% equity. Despite praise for the concept’s originality, the Sharks were discouraged by low sales ($10,000 across 75 stores) and the long 16-year gap in product development, leading all Sharks to decline investment.
nextSteps: The entrepreneurs plan to await Walmart’s decision on whether to keep Vestpakz in stores after the back-to-school season and continue testing with FAO Schwarz/Toys R Us.
